title: Classic Beef Bolognese (Ragù alla Bolognese)
description: The real deal from Bologna — slow-simmered, milk-tenderized, no garlic overload.
instructions: Heat oil and butter in a heavy pot. Render pancetta.
Add soffritto (onion, carrot, celery), cook slowly 15 min until sweet.
Add meats in batches, brown deeply.
Add milk, simmer until evaporated.
Add wine, simmer until evaporated.
Add tomatoes and barely cover with stock. Simmer 3–5 hours on lowest heat.
Finish with salt and pepper. Serve with tagliatelle and Parmigiano.
notes: Freezes for 3 months. Never serve with spaghetti in Italy.
proTips: Lowest possible simmer = key to flavor.

title: Japanese Soufflé Pancakes
description: Tall, jiggly, cloud-like pancakes.
instructions: Whisk yolks, milk, vanilla. Sift in flour + baking powder.
Beat whites to stiff peaks with sugar.
Fold meringue into yolk batter in 3 additions.
Cook in lightly oiled ring molds on lowest heat, covered, with water for steam.
Flip carefully, steam again. Serve immediately.
proTips: Zero grease on bowl/beaters or meringue fails.

title: Thai Green Chicken Curry (Gaeng Keow Wan)
description: Fragrant, spicy, made with homemade-level expectations.
instructions: Fry thick coconut cream with paste until fragrant.
Add chicken, coat well.
Pour in remaining coconut milk, lime leaves, seasoning.
Simmer 8 min, add eggplant, cook until tender.
Off heat, stir in basil and chilies.
proTips: Don’t boil coconut milk hard — it splits.

title: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
description: Restaurant-style creamy tomato butter chicken.
instructions: Marinate chicken 1–8 hrs in yogurt, spices, lemon.
Grill or pan-sear until charred.
Make sauce: butter → ginger-garlic → spices → passata → cream.
Add chicken, simmer 10 min, finish with kasuri methi and butter.
proTips: Char = flavor. Don’t skip grilling step.
Kasuri methi at the end is magic.

title: Classic French Onion Soup
description: Deeply caramelized onions, beef stock, gruyère crouton.
instructions: Caramelize onions in butter 45–60 min, low and slow.
Deglaze with wine, add stock, simmer 30 min.
Ladle into oven-safe bowls, top with baguette + cheese, broil until golden.
proTips: Patience on onions = 90% of the flavor.

title: Shakshuka (North African Eggs in Tomato Sauce)
description: Spicy, smoky, one-pan breakfast classic.
instructions: Sauté onion, pepper, garlic. Add spices.
Add tomatoes, simmer 10 min.
Make wells, crack eggs, cover until set.
Finish with feta, parsley, olive oil.

title: Individual Beef Wellington
description: Seared filet, mushroom duxelles, prosciutto, puff pastry.
instructions: Sear filet, coat with mustard, chill.
Make duxelles, cool completely.
Wrap in prosciutto, then pastry. Chill 30 min.
Egg wash, score, bake 200°C 20–25 min for medium-rare.
proTips: Everything must be cold before wrapping — or pastry melts.

title: Tonkotsu-Style Miso Ramen
description: Rich pork broth, miso tare, chashu, ajitama.
instructions: Boil bones 12–18 hrs for milky broth.
Make chashu and ajitama.
Blend miso tare.
Assemble: tare → broth → noodles → toppings.

title: Creamy Vegan Mushroom Risotto
description: No dairy, no compromise.
instructions: Sauté mushrooms hard, reserve.
Toast rice, deglaze with wine.
Add hot stock ladle by ladle, stirring constantly.
Finish with cashew cream and mushrooms.

title: Tacos al Pastor
description: Pineapple-marinated pork, spit-roasted style.
instructions: Marinate pork 3+ hrs in achiote, pineapple juice, spices.
Grill with pineapple slices.
Chop together, serve in warm corn tortillas with onion, cilantro, salsa.

title: Homemade Butter Croissants
description: 3-day laminated pastry perfection.
instructions: Day 1: Make détrempe, lock in butter, 3 turns.
Day 2: Final turn, shape, proof.
Day 3: Egg wash, bake 200°C 18–20 min.
proTips: Keep everything cold. Temperature control is life.

title: Authentic Philly Cheesesteak
description: Ribeye, Cooper Sharp, onions, amoroso roll.
instructions: Freeze ribeye 30 min, slice paper thin.
High-heat griddle: onions first, then beef in piles.
Chop together, melt cheese on top.
Stuff into toasted roll.

title: LA Galbi (Korean BBQ Short Ribs)
description: Flanken-cut, sweet-soy marinade.
instructions: Blend marinade, soak ribs 4–24 hrs.
Grill over high heat 2–3 min per side.
Serve with lettuce, ssamjang, rice.

title: Provençal Ratatouille
description: Not the Disney version — the real layered one.
instructions: Salt eggplant, sweat 30 min.
Slice everything 3mm thin.
Layer sauce → vegetables in spiral in cast iron.
Bake covered 180°C 60 min, uncovered 30 min.

title: 75% Hydration Sourdough Boule
description: Open crumb, blistered crust.
instructions: Autolyse 1 hr. Add starter and salt.
4–6 stretch & folds over 3 hrs.
Bulk ferment 12–16 hrs cold.
Shape, proof in basket, bake in Dutch oven 500°F 20 min lid on, 20 off.

title: Authentic Pad Thai
description: Street-style, tamarind-forward.
instructions: Soak noodles 30 min.
Make sauce: tamarind + palm sugar + fish sauce.
Wok: protein → egg → noodles → sauce → sprouts.
Serve with lime, chili, peanuts.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Britain’s national dish, done right.
instructions: Marinate & grill chicken.
Make masala sauce with butter, spices, tomato, cream.
Combine, simmer, finish with fenugreek.

title: Connecticut-Style Warm Lobster Roll
description: Hot buttered lobster, New England bun.
instructions: Gently warm lobster in butter.
Toast buns in butter on sides.
Stuff with lobster, drizzle extra butter.

title: Kimchi Bokkeumbap
description: Fast, funky, perfect.
instructions: High heat wok. Fry kimchi.
Add rice, break up, add juice and gochujang.
Top with egg and gim.

title: Molten Chocolate Lava Cake
description: Gooey center, 12 minutes.
instructions: Melt chocolate and butter.
Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar. Combine.
Fold in flour. Fill buttered ramekins ¾.
Bake 200°C exactly 12 min.

title: Real Caesar Salad (Table-side Style)
description: No bottled dressing allowed.
instructions: Mash anchovy and garlic with salt.
Whisk in yolk, lemon, then oil slowly.
Toss with romaine and cheese. Add croutons.

title: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
description: No cream. Ever.
instructions: Render guanciale until crisp.
Mix eggs and cheese.
Toss hot pasta with fat, then off-heat with egg mixture.
Add pasta water for creaminess.

title: Sushi Bake (Viral Filipino Style)
description: Deconstructed California roll casserole.
instructions: Season rice with vinegar mix.
Layer rice → crab-mayo-cream cheese mix.
Top with more mayo and furikake.
Bake 200°C 15–20 min until golden.

title: Beef Bourguignon (Julia Child)
description: 6-hour French beef stew in red wine.
instructions: Marinate beef overnight in wine.
Brown beef and bacon.
Slow cook 4 hrs with aromatics.
Sauté mushrooms and onions separately, add at end.

title: Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani
description: Layered, sealed, steamed perfection.
instructions: Marinate chicken 2 hrs.
Parboil rice with whole spices.
Layer chicken → rice → saffron → fried onions.
Seal pot with dough, cook on dum 40 min.

title: Japanese Tonkatsu (Pork Cutlet)
description: Crispy panko, cabbage, tonkatsu sauce.
instructions: Pound pork to 1cm, season.
Flour → egg → panko.
Fry 160°C oil 5–6 min until golden.
Rest 3 min, slice, serve with sauce and cabbage.

title: Crispy Homemade Falafel
description: From dried chickpeas only.
instructions: Soak chickpeas 12–24 hrs.
Pulse with herbs and spices — keep chunky.
Rest mix 30 min, add baking soda.
Shape, deep fry 170°C 4–5 min.

title: Classic Crème Brûlée
description: Silky custard, crackly sugar top.
instructions: Heat cream with vanilla to just below boil.
Temper into yolks + sugar.
Strain, pour into ramekins.
Water bath 150°C 35–40 min. Chill 4 hrs. Torch sugar.

title: Vietnamese Bánh Mì Thit Nuong
description: Grilled pork, pickled veg, baguette.
instructions: Marinate pork 1 hr.
Grill until caramelized.
Pickle daikon and carrot.
Assemble: mayo → pâté → pork → pickles → cucumber → cilantro → chili.

title: Korean Braised Beef Short Ribs (Galbi-jjim)
description: Tender, sweet-savory, festive dish.
instructions: Soak and blanch ribs to clean.
Blend marinade with pear and onion.
Braise 2.5 hrs, add vegetables last hour.
Reduce sauce, garnish with sesame and pine nuts.

title: Classic Beef Bolognese (Ragù alla Bolognese)
description: The authentic slow-simmered meat sauce from Bologna. Milk step included.
instructions: Render pancetta in oil + butter.
Add soffritto, cook slowly 15 min.
Brown meats deeply in batches.
Add milk → evaporate completely.
Add wine → evaporate.
Add tomatoes + stock. Simmer 3–5 hours on lowest heat.
Serve with tagliatelle and Parmigiano-Reggiano.
notes: Freezes perfectly for 3 months. Never use spaghetti.
proTips: Milk tenderizes the meat. Lowest simmer = deepest flavor.

title: Japanese Soufflé Pancakes
description: Ultra-tall, fluffy, jiggly pancakes cooked in ring molds.
instructions: Whisk yolks, milk, vanilla. Sift in flour + baking powder.
Beat whites to stiff peaks, gradually adding sugar.
Fold meringue into yolk batter in 3 additions.
Cook in oiled ring molds on lowest heat, covered, with water for steam.
Flip carefully, steam again. Serve immediately.
notes: Temperature control is critical. Too hot = collapse.
proTips: Grease-free bowl and beaters for perfect meringue.

title: Thai Green Chicken Curry (Gaeng Keow Wan)
description: Fragrant, spicy, creamy curry made with proper coconut technique.
instructions: Fry thick coconut cream with paste until fragrant and split.
Add chicken, coat in paste.
Pour in remaining coconut milk, lime leaves, seasoning.
Simmer 8 min, add eggplant, cook until tender.
Off heat, stir in Thai basil.
notes: Never hard-boil coconut milk or it splits.
proTips: Taste order: salty → sweet → rich → spicy.

title: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
description: Creamy, tomato-based Indian classic with charred tandoori chicken.
instructions: Marinate chicken 2–8 hrs in yogurt + spices.
Grill or broil until charred.
Make sauce: butter → ginger-garlic → spices → passata → cream.
Add chicken, simmer 15 min. Finish with kasuri methi and butter.
notes: Char is essential for authentic flavor.
proTips: Kasuri methi at the end is non-negotiable.

title: Classic French Onion Soup
description: Deeply caramelized onions, rich beef stock, gruyère crouton.
instructions: Caramelize onions in butter over low heat 45–60 min.
Deglaze with wine, add stock, simmer 30 min.
Ladle into oven-safe bowls, top with bread + cheese, broil until golden.
notes: Patience with onions = 90% of the flavor.
proTips: Don’t rush caramelization — low and slow.

title: Shakshuka
description: Spiced tomato and pepper stew with poached eggs.
instructions: Sauté onion, pepper, garlic. Add spices.
Add tomatoes, simmer 10 min until thick.
Make wells, crack eggs, cover until set.
Finish with feta, parsley, olive oil.
proTips: Don’t overcook the eggs — runny yolk is key.

title: Beef Wellington
description: Seared filet mignon with mushroom duxelles wrapped in puff pastry.
instructions: Sear beef, coat with mustard, chill.
Make duxelles, cool completely.
Layer prosciutto, duxelles, beef, wrap tightly in pastry.
Chill 30 min, egg wash, score, bake 200°C 35–40 min.
proTips: Everything must be cold before wrapping.

title: Tonkotsu Ramen
description: Rich 18-hour pork bone broth with chashu and ajitama.
instructions: Boil bones hard 18 hrs for milky broth.
Roll and braise pork belly for chashu.
Marinate soft-boiled eggs in soy mixture.
Assemble: tare → hot broth → noodles → toppings.
notes: Broth can be frozen for months.

title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
description: Classic Italian risotto with mixed mushrooms and parmesan.
instructions: Sauté mushrooms hard, reserve.
Toast rice in butter, deglaze with wine.
Add hot stock ladle by ladle, stirring constantly.
Finish with butter, cheese, and mushrooms.

title: Tacos al Pastor
description: Pineapple-marinated pork, spit-roasted style, served in corn tortillas.
instructions: Marinate pork 3+ hours in achiote and pineapple juice.
Grill pork and pineapple slices.
Chop together, serve in warm tortillas with onion, cilantro, salsa.

title: Homemade Butter Croissants
description: 3-day laminated dough for perfect flaky layers.
instructions: Day 1: Make détrempe, encase butter, 3 single turns.
Day 2: Final turn, roll, shape croissants, proof.
Day 3: Egg wash, bake 200°C 18–20 min.
notes: Cold ingredients and environment are crucial.
proTips: Keep butter block firm throughout lamination.

title: Authentic Philly Cheesesteak
description: Thin-sliced ribeye, Cooper Sharp, onions, Amoroso roll.
instructions: Freeze ribeye 30 min, slice paper-thin.
High-heat griddle: onions first, then beef in piles.
Chop together, melt cheese on top.
Stuff into toasted roll.
notes: No lettuce, tomato, or mayo in Philly.

title: LA Galbi (Korean BBQ Short Ribs)
description: Flanken-cut short ribs in sweet soy marinade.
instructions: Blend marinade with pear, garlic, soy, sugar.
Marinate ribs 4–24 hours.
Grill over high heat 2–3 min per side.
Serve with lettuce wraps and ssamjang.
proTips: Cut against the bone for easy eating.

title: Provençal Ratatouille
description: Beautiful layered vegetable tian with herb-infused tomato sauce.
instructions: Salt eggplant slices, sweat 30 min.
Layer sauce and vegetables in spiral pattern.
Drizzle with olive oil, cover with parchment.
Bake 180°C covered 60 min, uncovered 30 min.

title: 75% Hydration Sourdough Boule
description: High-hydration artisan bread with open crumb.
instructions: Autolyse flours and water 1 hr.
Add starter and salt, 4–6 stretch & folds.
Bulk ferment 12–16 hrs in fridge.
Shape, proof in basket, bake in Dutch oven.
notes: Cold proof improves flavor and handling.

title: Pad Thai
description: Authentic street-style tamarind noodle stir-fry.
instructions: Soak noodles 30 min.
Make sauce with tamarind, palm sugar, fish sauce.
High-heat wok: protein → egg → noodles → sauce → sprouts.
Serve with lime, peanuts, chili flakes.
notes: Cook one portion at a time for best texture.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Britain’s favorite curry with charred chicken in spiced tomato cream sauce.
instructions: Marinate and grill chicken until charred.
Make masala sauce with butter, spices, tomato, cream.
Add chicken, simmer, finish with fenugreek leaves.

title: Connecticut-Style Warm Lobster Roll
description: Hot buttered lobster in a toasted New England bun.
instructions: Gently warm lobster in melted butter.
Toast buns on sides in butter.
Stuff with lobster, drizzle extra butter.

title: Kimchi Fried Rice (Kimchi Bokkeumbap)
description: Quick, spicy, funky fried rice with kimchi and gochujang.
instructions: High heat: fry kimchi until caramelized.
Add rice, break up clumps.
Add kimchi juice and gochujang.
Top with fried egg and seaweed.

title: Molten Chocolate Lava Cake
description: Warm chocolate cake with gooey molten center.
instructions: Melt chocolate and butter together.
Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar. Combine with chocolate.
Fold in flour. Fill buttered ramekins ¾ full.
Bake 200°C exactly 12 minutes.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
description: Traditional tableside dressing with anchovies and raw egg yolk.
instructions: Mash anchovy and garlic with salt.
Whisk in yolk, lemon juice, then oil slowly.
Toss with crisp romaine and shaved parmesan.
Add croutons and black pepper.
proTips: Coddled egg yolk if concerned about raw.

title: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
description: Roman classic with guanciale, egg, and Pecorino.
instructions: Render guanciale until crisp.
Mix eggs and cheese into paste.
Toss hot pasta with guanciale fat off heat.
Add egg mixture + pasta water for creaminess.

title: Sushi Bake
description: Viral Filipino-style deconstructed California roll casserole.
instructions: Season rice with sushi vinegar.
Mix crab, cream cheese, mayo.
Layer rice → crab mix → more mayo + furikake.
Bake 200°C 15–20 min until golden.
proTips: Broil last 2 min for extra color.

title: Beef Bourguignon
description: Classic French red wine beef stew with bacon, mushrooms, and pearl onions.
instructions: Marinate beef overnight in wine.
Brown beef and bacon separately.
Slow cook 4 hours with aromatics.
Sauté mushrooms and onions, add at end.

title: Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani
description: Layered rice and marinated chicken steamed under dough seal.
instructions: Marinate chicken 2+ hours.
Parboil rice with whole spices.
Layer chicken → rice → saffron milk → fried onions.
Seal pot with dough, cook on dum 40 min.

title: Japanese Tonkatsu
description: Crispy panko-fried pork cutlet with tonkatsu sauce.
instructions: Pound pork to 1 cm thickness.
Standard breading: flour → egg → panko.
Fry 160°C oil 5–6 min until golden.
Rest 3 min, slice, serve with sauce and cabbage.

title: Crispy Homemade Falafel
description: Made from soaked dried chickpeas, never canned.
instructions: Soak chickpeas 12–24 hrs.
Pulse with herbs and spices — keep chunky.
Rest mixture 30 min, add baking soda.
Shape and deep fry 170°C 4–5 min.

title: Classic Crème Brûlée
description: Silky vanilla custard with caramelized sugar crust.
instructions: Heat cream with vanilla to just below boil.
Temper into yolks + sugar mixture.
Strain, pour into ramekins.
Water bath 150°C 35–40 min. Chill 4+ hrs. Torch sugar.

title: Vietnamese Bánh Mì Thit Nuong
description: Grilled pork, pickled vegetables, and pâté in a baguette.
instructions: Marinate pork 1+ hour.
Quick-pickle daikon and carrot.
Grill pork until caramelized.
Assemble: mayo → pâté → pork → pickles → cucumber → cilantro → chili.

title: Korean Braised Short Ribs (Galbi-jjim)
description: Tender fall-off-the-bone short ribs in sweet-savory sauce.
instructions: Soak and blanch ribs to remove impurities.
Blend marinade with pear, onion, garlic.
Braise 2.5 hours, add vegetables last hour.
Reduce sauce, garnish with sesame and pine nuts.
proTips: Blanching step removes blood and odor.
